translated: The Elder Yaññasāmi’s Birth Story
“When I was seven years old,🔽I had mastered the Vedas;
I was the one who set up the family tradition,
the sacrifice was undertaken by me.
Eighty-four thousand animals
were slaughtered at that time for me;
The horses and the elephants were brought,
they were prepared for the sacrifice.
As if shaken by the mouth of a furnace,
like the charcoal of acacia wood;
Like the rising sun,
like the moon on the full moon day.
The one who is successful in all things,
the one who is honoured by the three worlds, the one who is beneficial;
The Fully Enlightened One approached,
and spoke these words:
‘Non-violence to all living beings,

original: kumāra mama ruccati;🔽Theyyā ca aticārā ca,

translated: Prince, is pleasing to me;🔽Stealing and adultery,
drinking alcohol and delighting in sensual pleasures.

translated: Delight in equanimity,🔽great learning and gratitude;
In this very life and in the next,
these things are to be praised.
Having developed these things,
delighting in the welfare of all beings;
Having confidence in the Buddha,
develop the supreme path.’
Having said this, the Omniscient One,
The world’s chief, the bull of men,
Having instructed me thus,

translated: he rose up into the sky and departed.🔽First purifying my mind,🔽afterwards I gladdened my mind;
Through the gladdening of my mind,
I was reborn in Tusita.
For ninety-four aeons,
when I gladdened my mind,
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the Buddha-perception.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Yaññasāmī recited these verses.
